025package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.hsluv;
026
027import com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.FloatColors;
028import com.github.tommyettinger.digital.BitConversion;
029import com.github.tommyettinger.digital.TrigTools;
030
031import java.util.Random;
032
033/**
034 * Contains code for manipulating colors as {@code int} and packed {@code float} values in the HSLuv color space.
035 * See <a href="https://www.hsluv.org/">HSLuv's website</a> for more info.
036 * <br>
037 * The HSLuv color space has 3 channels, Hue, Saturation, and Lightness. Lightness should be much more even when hue and
038 * saturation change, when compared with "vanilla" HSL or HSV. This also has an alpha channel in each color,
039 * which acts like it does in every other color space package here (multiplicative alpha, higher is more opaque).
040 */
041public class ColorTools {
042    /**
043     * No need to instantiate.
044     */
045    private ColorTools(){
046    }
047    /**
048     * Gets a packed float representation of a color given as 4 float components, here, hue, saturation, lightness, and
049     * alpha (or opacity). H should be between 0 and 1, inclusive, with 0.0f or so meaning reddish, 0.3f or so meaning
050     * greenish, and 0.7 or so meaning bluish. S should be between 0 and 1, inclusive, with 0 meaning grayscale and 1
051     * meaning fully bold/bright. L should be between 0 and 1, inclusive, with 0 used for very dark colors (almost only
052     * black), and 1 used for very light colors (almost only white). Alpha is the multiplicative opacity of the color,
053     * and acts like RGBA's alpha.
054     *
055     * @param h     0f to 1f, hue component, with 0.0f meaning red, 0.3 meaning green, and 0.7 meaning blue
056     * @param s     0f to 1f, saturation component, with 0.0f meaning grayscale and 1.0f meaning fully bold/bright
057     * @param l     0f to 1f, lightness component, with 0.5f meaning "no change" and 1f brightening
058     * @param alpha 0f to 1f, 0f makes the color transparent and 1f makes it opaque
059     * @return a float encoding a color with the given properties
060     */
061    public static float hsluv(float h, float s, float l, float alpha) {
062        return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(((int) (alpha * 255.999f) << 24 & 0xFE000000) | ((int) (l * 255.999f) << 16 & 0xFF0000)
063                | ((int) (s * 255.999f) << 8 & 0xFF00) | ((int) (h * 255.999f) & 0xFF));
064    }
065    /**
066     * Gets a packed float representation of a color given as 4 float components, H, S, L, and alpha, with the S, L, and
067     * alpha components clamped to the 0f to 1f range before being entered into the packed float color, while H is
068     * wrapped into the same range. This is only different from {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)} in that it
069     * clamps or wraps each component.
070     *
071     * @see #hsluv(float, float, float, float) This uses the same definitions for H, S, L, and alpha as hsluv().
072     * @param h     0f to 1f, hue component, with 0.0f meaning red, 0.3 meaning green, and 0.7 meaning blue
073     * @param s     0f to 1f, saturation component, with 0.0f meaning grayscale and 1.0f meaning fully bold/bright
074     * @param l     0f to 1f, lightness component, with 0.5f meaning "no change" and 1f brightening
075     * @param alpha 0f to 1f, 0f makes the color transparent and 1f makes it opaque
076     * @return a float encoding a color with the given properties
077     */
078    public static float clamp(float h, float s, float l, float alpha) {
079        return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat((Math.min(Math.max((int) (alpha * 127.999f), 0), 127) << 25)
080                | (Math.min(Math.max((int) (l * 255.999f), 0), 255) << 16)
081                | (Math.min(Math.max((int) (s * 255.999f), 0), 255) << 8)
082                | (int) ((h - floor(h)) * 256f)
083        );
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * An approximation of the cube-root function for float inputs and outputs.
088     * This can be about twice as fast as {@link Math#cbrt(double)}. This
089     * version does not tolerate negative inputs, because in the narrow use
090     * case it has in this class, it never is given negative inputs.
091     * <br>
092     * Has very low relative error (less than 1E-9) when inputs are uniformly
093     * distributed between 0 and 512, and absolute mean error of less than
094     * 1E-6 in the same scenario. Uses a bit-twiddling method similar to one
095     * presented in Hacker's Delight and also used in early 3D graphics (see
096     * https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fast_inverse_square_root for more, but
097     * this code approximates cbrt(x) and not 1/sqrt(x)). This specific code
098     * was originally by Marc B. Reynolds, posted in his "Stand-alone-junk"
099     * repo: https://github.com/Marc-B-Reynolds/Stand-alone-junk/blob/master/src/Posts/ballcube.c#L182-L197 .
100     * It's worth noting that while hardware instructions for finding the
101     * square root of a float have gotten extremely fast, the same is not
102     * true for the cube root (which has to allow negative inputs), so while
103     * the bit-twiddling inverse square root is no longer a beneficial
104     * optimization on current hardware, this does seem to help.
105     * <br>
106     * This is used when converting from RGB to HSLuv, as an intermediate step.
107     * @param x any non-negative finite float to find the cube root of
108     * @return the cube root of x, approximated
109     */
110    private static float cbrtPositive(float x) {
111        int ix = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(x);
112        final float x0 = x;
113        ix = (ix>>>2) + (ix>>>4);
114        ix += (ix>>>4);
115        ix += (ix>>>8) + 0x2A5137A0;
116        x  = BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(ix);
117        x  = 0.33333334f*(2f * x + x0/(x*x));
118        x  = 0.33333334f*(1.9999999f * x + x0/(x*x));
119        return x;
120    }
121
122    /**
123     * The same as floor() from libGDX's MathUtils class, this gets the int floor of a float between -16384 and 16384.
124     * @param f a float between -16384 and 16384
125     * @return the floor of f, as an int
126     */
127    private static int floor(final float f) {
128        return (int)(f + 0x1p14) - 0x4000;
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * Used when given non-linear sRGB inputs to make them linear, using an exact gamma of 2.4 and accounting for the
133     * darkest colors with a different formula. This is rather close to squaring {@code component}.
134     * @param component any non-linear channel of a color, to be made linear
135     * @return a linear version of component
136     */
137    private static float forwardGamma(final float component) {
138        return component < 0.04045f ? component * (1f/12.92f) : (float)Math.pow((component + 0.055f) * (1f/1.055f), 2.4f);
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Used to return from a linear, gamma-corrected input to an sRGB, non-linear output, using an exact gamma of 2.4
143     * and accounting for the darkest colors with a different formula. This is mostly similar to the square root, but is
144     * more precise for very dark colors.
145     * @param component a linear channel of a color, to be made non-linear
146     * @return a non-linear version of component
147     */
148    private static float reverseGamma(final float component) {
149        return component < 0.0031308f ? component * 12.92f : (float)Math.pow(component, 1f/2.4f) * 1.055f - 0.055f;
150    }
151
152    /**
153     * Changes the curve of a requested L value so that it matches the internally-used curve. This takes a curve with a
154     * dark area similar to sRGB (a fairly small one), and makes it significantly larger. This is typically used on
155     * "to HSLuv" conversions. This is much less potent of a change than the method used by Oklab.
156     * @param L lightness, from 0 to 1 inclusive
157     * @return an adjusted L value that can be used internally
158     */
159    public static float forwardLight(final float L) {
160        final float shape = 0.8528f, turning = 0.1f;
161        final float d = turning - L;
162        if(d < 0)
163            return ((1f - turning) * (L - 1f)) / (1f - (L + shape * d)) + 1f;
164        else
165            return (turning * L) / (1e-20f + (L + shape * d));
166    }
167    /**
168     * Changes the curve of the internally-used lightness when it is output to another format. This makes the dark area
169     * area smaller, matching (kind-of) the curve that the standard sRGB lightness uses. This is typically used on "from
170     * HSLuv" conversions. This is much less potent of a change than the method used by Oklab.
171     * @param L lightness, from 0 to 1 inclusive
172     * @return an adjusted L value that can be fed into a conversion to RGBA or something similar
173     */
174    public static float reverseLight(final float L) {
175        final float shape = 1.1726f, turning = 0.1f;
176        final float d = turning - L;
177        if(d < 0)
178            return ((1f - turning) * (L - 1f)) / (1f - (L + shape * d)) + 1f;
179        else
180            return (turning * L) / (1e-20f + (L + shape * d));
181    }
182
183    private static final float[][] m = new float[][] {
184            new float[] {+3.2404542f, -1.5371385f, -0.4985314f},
185            new float[] {-0.9692660f, +1.8760108f, +0.0415560f},
186            new float[] {+0.0556434f, -0.2040259f, +1.0572252f},
187    };
188    private static final float refU = 0.19783000664283f, refV = 0.46831999493879f;
189    private static final float kappa = 9.032962962f, epsilon = 0.0088564516f;
190
191    /**
192     * Converts a packed float color in the format produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)} to an RGBA8888 int.
193     * This format of int can be used with Pixmap and in some other places in libGDX.
194     * @param packed a packed float color, as produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
195     * @return an RGBA8888 int color
196     */
197    public static int toRGBA8888(final float packed)
198    {
199        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(packed);
200        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
201        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
202        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
203
204        // HSLuv to Lch
205        float C;
206        if (L > 0.99999f) {
207            L = 1;
208            C = 0;
209        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
210            L = 0;
211            C = 0;
212        } else
213            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
214
215        // Lch to Luv
216        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
217        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
218
219        // Luv to XYZ
220        float x, y, z;
221        if (L < 0.00001f) {
222            return (decoded & 0xfe000000) >>> 24 | decoded >>> 31;
223        } else if(L > 0.9999f) {
224            return 0xFFFFFF00 | (decoded & 0xfe000000) >>> 24 | decoded >>> 31;
225        }else {
226            if (L <= 0.08f)
227                y = L / kappa;
228            else {
229                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
230                y *= y * y;
231            }
232            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
233            float varU = U * iL + refU;
234            float varV = V * iL + refV;
235            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
236            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
237        }
238        final int r = (int)(reverseGamma(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z) * 255.999f);
239        final int g = (int)(reverseGamma(-0.9692660f * x + +1.8760108f * y + +0.0415560f * z) * 255.999f);
240        final int b = (int)(reverseGamma(+0.0556434f * x + -0.2040259f * y + +1.0572252f * z) * 255.999f);
241        return r << 24 | g << 16 | b << 8 | (decoded & 0xfe000000) >>> 24 | decoded >>> 31;
242    }
243
244    /**
245     * Converts a packed float color in the format produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
246     * to a packed float in ABGR8888 format.
247     * This format of float can be used with the standard SpriteBatch and in some other places in libGDX.
248     * @param packed a packed float color, as produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
249     * @return a packed float color as ABGR8888
250     */
251    public static float toRGBA(final float packed)
252    {
253        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(packed);
254        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
255        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
256        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
257
258        // HSLuv to Lch
259        float C;
260        if (L > 0.99999f) {
261            L = 1;
262            C = 0;
263        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
264            L = 0;
265            C = 0;
266        } else
267            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
268
269        // Lch to Luv
270        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
271        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
272
273        // Luv to XYZ
274        float x, y, z;
275        if (L < 0.00001f) {
276            return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(decoded & 0xfe000000);
277        } else if(L > 0.9999f) {
278            return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(0xFFFFFF | (decoded & 0xfe000000));
279        }else {
280            if (L <= 0.08f)
281                y = L / kappa;
282            else {
283                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
284                y *= y * y;
285            }
286            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
287            float varU = U * iL + refU;
288            float varV = V * iL + refV;
289            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
290            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
291        }
292        final int r = (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
293        final int g = (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(-0.9692660f * x + +1.8760108f * y + +0.0415560f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
294        final int b = (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+0.0556434f * x + -0.2040259f * y + +1.0572252f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
295        return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(r | g << 8 | b << 16 | (decoded & 0xfe000000));
296    }
297
298    /**
299     * Takes a color encoded as an RGBA8888 int and converts to a packed float in the HSLuv format this uses.
300     * @param rgba an int with the channels (in order) red, green, blue, alpha; should have 8 bits per channel
301     * @return a packed float as HSLuv, which this class can use
302     */
303    public static float fromRGBA8888(final int rgba) {
304        final float r = forwardGamma((rgba >>> 24) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
305        final float g = forwardGamma((rgba >>> 16 & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
306        final float b = forwardGamma((rgba >>> 8 & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
307
308        final float x = /* forwardXYZ */(0.4124564f * r  + 0.3575761f * g + 0.1804375f * b);
309        final float y = /* forwardXYZ */(0.2126729f * r  + 0.7151522f * g + 0.0721750f * b);
310        final float z = /* forwardXYZ */(0.0193339f * r  + 0.1191920f * g + 0.9503041f * b);
311
312        // XYZ to Luv
313        float L = 1.16f * cbrtPositive(y) - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
314        if (L < 0.00001f) {
315            L = 0;
316            U = 0;
317            V = 0;
318        } else {
319            U = 13 * L * (4 * x / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refU);
320            V = 13 * L * (9 * y / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refV);
321        }
322
323        // Luv to Lch
324        float C = (float)Math.sqrt(U * U + V * V);
325        h = TrigTools.atan2Turns(V, U);
326
327        // Lch to HSLuv
328        if (L > 0.99999f) {
329            s = 0;
330            l = 1;
331        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
332            s = 0;
333            l = 0;
334        } else {
335            l = forwardLight(L);
336            s = Math.min(C / chromaLimit(h, l), 1);
337        }
338        return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(
339                          Math.min(Math.max((int)(h * 255.999f    ), 0), 255)
340                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(s * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 8
341                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(l * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 16
342                        | (rgba & 0xFE) << 24);
343    }
344
345    /**
346     * Takes a color encoded as an ABGR packed float and converts to a packed float in the HSLuv format this uses.
347     * @param packed a packed float in ABGR8888 format, with A in the MSB and R in the LSB
348     * @return a packed float as HSLuv, which this class can use
349     */
350    public static float fromRGBA(final float packed) {
351        final int abgr = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(packed);
352        final float r = forwardGamma((abgr & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
353        final float g = forwardGamma((abgr >>> 8 & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
354        final float b = forwardGamma((abgr >>> 16 & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
355
356        final float x = /* forwardXYZ */(0.4124564f * r  + 0.3575761f * g + 0.1804375f * b);
357        final float y = /* forwardXYZ */(0.2126729f * r  + 0.7151522f * g + 0.0721750f * b);
358        final float z = /* forwardXYZ */(0.0193339f * r  + 0.1191920f * g + 0.9503041f * b);
359
360        // XYZ to Luv
361        float L = 1.16f * cbrtPositive(y) - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
362//        float L = 1.16f * y - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
363        if (L < 0.00001f) {
364            L = 0;
365            U = 0;
366            V = 0;
367        } else {
368            U = 13 * L * (4 * x / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refU);
369            V = 13 * L * (9 * y / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refV);
370        }
371
372        // Luv to Lch
373        float C = (float)Math.sqrt(U * U + V * V);
374        h = TrigTools.atan2Turns(V, U);
375
376        // Lch to HSLuv
377        if (L > 0.99999f) {
378            s = 0;
379            l = 1;
380        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
381            s = 0;
382            l = 0;
383        } else {
384            l = forwardLight(L);
385            s = Math.min(C / chromaLimit(h, l), 1);
386        }
387        return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(
388                Math.min(Math.max((int)(h * 255.999f    ), 0), 255)
389                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(s * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 8
390                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(l * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 16
391                        | (abgr & 0xFE000000));
392    }
393
394    /**
395     * Takes RGBA components from 0.0 to 1.0 each and converts to a packed float in the HSLuv format this uses.
396     * @param r red, from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive)
397     * @param g green, from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive)
398     * @param b blue, from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive)
399     * @param a alpha, from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive)
400     * @return a packed float as HSLuv, which this class can use
401     */
402    public static float fromRGBA(float r, float g, float b, final float a) {
403        r = forwardGamma(r);
404        g = forwardGamma(g);
405        b = forwardGamma(b);
406
407        final float x = /* forwardXYZ */(0.4124564f * r  + 0.3575761f * g + 0.1804375f * b);
408        final float y = /* forwardXYZ */(0.2126729f * r  + 0.7151522f * g + 0.0721750f * b);
409        final float z = /* forwardXYZ */(0.0193339f * r  + 0.1191920f * g + 0.9503041f * b);
410
411        // XYZ to Luv
412        float L = 1.16f * cbrtPositive(y) - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
413        if (L < 0.00001f) {
414            L = 0;
415            U = 0;
416            V = 0;
417        } else {
418            U = 13 * L * (4 * x / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refU);
419            V = 13 * L * (9 * y / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refV);
420        }
421
422        // Luv to Lch
423        float C = (float)Math.sqrt(U * U + V * V);
424        h = TrigTools.atan2Turns(V, U);
425
426
427        // Lch to HSLuv
428        if (L > 0.99999f) {
429            s = 0;
430            l = 1;
431        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
432            s = 0;
433            l = 0;
434        } else {
435            l = forwardLight(L);
436            s = Math.min(C / chromaLimit(h, l), 1);
437        }
438        return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(
439                Math.min(Math.max((int)(h * 255.999f    ), 0), 255)
440                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(s * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 8
441                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(l * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 16
442                        | ((int)(a * 255f) << 24 & 0xFE000000));
443    }
444
445        /**
446         * Gets the red channel value of the given encoded color, as an int ranging from 0 to 255, inclusive.
447         * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
448         * @return an int from 0 to 255, inclusive, representing the red channel value of the given encoded color
449         */
450        public static int redInt(final float encoded)
451        {
452        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
453        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
454        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
455        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
456
457        // HSLuv to Lch
458        float C;
459        if (L > 0.99999f) {
460            L = 1;
461            C = 0;
462        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
463            L = 0;
464            C = 0;
465        } else
466            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
467
468        // Lch to Luv
469        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
470        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
471
472        // Luv to XYZ
473        float x, y, z;
474        if (L < 0.00001f) {
475            x = 0;
476            y = 0;
477            z = 0;
478        } else {
479            if (L <= 0.08f)
480                y = L / kappa;
481            else {
482                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
483                y *= y * y;
484            }
485            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
486            float varU = U * iL + refU;
487            float varV = V * iL + refV;
488            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
489            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
490        }
491        return (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
492        }
493
494        /**
495         * Gets the green channel value of the given encoded color, as an int ranging from 0 to 255, inclusive.
496         * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
497         * @return an int from 0 to 255, inclusive, representing the green channel value of the given encoded color
498         */
499        public static int greenInt(final float encoded)
500        {
501        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
502        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
503        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
504        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
505
506        // HSLuv to Lch
507        float C;
508        if (L > 0.99999f) {
509            L = 1;
510            C = 0;
511        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
512            L = 0;
513            C = 0;
514        } else
515            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
516
517        // Lch to Luv
518        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
519        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
520
521        // Luv to XYZ
522        float x, y, z;
523        if (L < 0.00001f) {
524            x = 0;
525            y = 0;
526            z = 0;
527        } else {
528            if (L <= 0.08f)
529                y = L / kappa;
530            else {
531                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
532                y *= y * y;
533            }
534            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
535            float varU = U * iL + refU;
536            float varV = V * iL + refV;
537            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
538            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
539        }
540        return (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(-0.9692660f * x + +1.8760108f * y + +0.0415560f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
541        }
542
543        /**
544         * Gets the blue channel value of the given encoded color, as an int ranging from 0 to 255, inclusive.
545         * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
546         * @return an int from 0 to 255, inclusive, representing the blue channel value of the given encoded color
547         */
548        public static int blueInt(final float encoded)
549        {
550        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
551        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
552        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
553        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
554
555        // HSLuv to Lch
556        float C;
557        if (L > 0.99999f) {
558            L = 1;
559            C = 0;
560        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
561            L = 0;
562            C = 0;
563        } else
564            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
565
566        // Lch to Luv
567        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
568        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
569
570        // Luv to XYZ
571        float x, y, z;
572        if (L < 0.00001f) {
573            x = 0;
574            y = 0;
575            z = 0;
576        } else {
577            if (L <= 0.08f)
578                y = L / kappa;
579            else {
580                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
581                y *= y * y;
582            }
583            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
584            float varU = U * iL + refU;
585            float varV = V * iL + refV;
586            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
587            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
588        }
589        return (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+0.0556434f * x + -0.2040259f * y + +1.0572252f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
590        }
591
592        /**
593         * Gets the alpha channel value of the given encoded color, as an even int ranging from 0 to 254, inclusive. Because
594         * of how alpha is stored in libGDX, no odd-number values are possible for alpha.
595         * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
596         * @return an even int from 0 to 254, inclusive, representing the alpha channel value of the given encoded color
597         */
598        public static int alphaInt(final float encoded)
599        {
600                return (BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(encoded) & 0xfe000000) >>> 24;
601        }
602    /**
603     * Gets the red channel value of the given encoded color, as a float from 0.0f to 1.0f, inclusive.
604     * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
605     * @return a float from 0.0f to 1.0f, inclusive, representing the red channel value of the given encoded color
606     */
607    public static float red(final float encoded)
608    {
609        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
610        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
611        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
612        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
613
614        // HSLuv to Lch
615        float C;
616        if (L > 0.99999f) {
617            L = 1;
618            C = 0;
619        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
620            L = 0;
621            C = 0;
622        } else
623            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
624
625        // Lch to Luv
626        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
627        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
628
629        // Luv to XYZ
630        float x, y, z;
631        if (L < 0.00001f) {
632            x = 0;
633            y = 0;
634            z = 0;
635        } else {
636            if (L <= 0.08f)
637                y = L / kappa;
638            else {
639                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
640                y *= y * y;
641            }
642            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
643            float varU = U * iL + refU;
644            float varV = V * iL + refV;
645            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
646            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
647        }
648        return reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z, 0f), 1f));
649    }

651    /**
652     * Gets the green channel value of the given encoded color, as a float from 0.0f to 1.0f, inclusive.
653     * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
654     * @return a float from 0.0f to 1.0f, inclusive, representing the green channel value of the given encoded color
655     */
656    public static float green(final float encoded)
657    {
658        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
659        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
660        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
661        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
662
663        // HSLuv to Lch
664        float C;
665        if (L > 0.99999f) {
666            L = 1;
667            C = 0;
668        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
669            L = 0;
670            C = 0;
671        } else
672            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
673
674        // Lch to Luv
675        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;

677

686                y = L / kappa;

688                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;

690            }

692            float varU = U * iL + refU;
693            float varV = V * iL + refV;
694            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
695            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
696        }
697        return reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(-0.9692660f * x + +1.8760108f * y + +0.0415560f * z, 0f), 1f));
698    }

700    /**

703     * @return a float from 0.0f to 1.0f, inclusive, representing the blue channel value of the given encoded color
704     */

711

713        float C;
714        if (L > 0.99999f) {
715            L = 1;
716            C = 0;
717        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
718            L = 0;
719            C = 0;
720        } else
721            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;

731            y = 0;
